comments.comment: Seems like conda is not completing channel installation of cmake prior to pip installation of xlearn. ðŸ˜” There's still an open issue on building a conda feedstock for xlearn. In the meantime we can revert the removal of explicit cmake installation in the dockerfile. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yueguoguo>@yueguoguo</denchmark-link> should we remove cmake and xlearn from the conda env script and add instructions to build it separately?
Maybe we can still keep xlearn in the conda env but install cmake separately.
sure, let's just drop cmake from conda, add it to docker and then we can add a note in the setup readme indicating xlearn requires cmake.
